[File: aptos-core/api/src/log.rs] [Function: middleware_log()] [Log Injection via Status] While status codes are controlled, can custom error handling create status codes outside standard ranges (100-599) causing log parser confusion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/log.rs] [Function: determine_request_source_client()] [Metric Poisoning] By controlling client string content within regex constraints, can attackers poison metrics to trigger false alerts or hide real attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/log.rs] [Function: middleware_log()] [Cross-Origin Information Leak] Referer header logging at line 68 - can CORS requests leak cross-origin URLs revealing user behavior on other sites? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/log.rs] [Function: middleware_log()] [Error Context Loss] If get_response() fails at line 90, no logging occurs for the failed request - does this hide attack attempts that cause early failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/log.rs] [Function: extract_trace_context()] [Hash Collision] With 32-char hex trace_id, birthday paradox - can attackers intentionally collide trace IDs to link unrelated requests in distributed tracing? (Low)
